title: Drawing, "Design for Doorway in the Villa Albani, Rome", 1755–56
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown and gray wash, graphite on cream laid paper
markings:
Marks: In the form of "IV". See Churchill, p. 21 s.
Stamps: Verso, in black ink: Museum for the Arts of Decoration, Cooper Union.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: The doorway is flanked by two pilasters with dolphins supporting festoons at capitals. An entablature with a frieze and a semi-circular window aboveit are outlined at the top of the drawing. Above doorway molding is a classical frieze with a scene of sacrifice. Seated griffins appear on either side of the frieze. Above this is a lower entablature surmounted byan eagle. Several people and two dogs stand in and around the doorway

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for Doorway in the Villa Albani, Rome", 1755–56.
1755–56. Pen and brown ink, brush and brown and gray wash, graphite on cream laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-2178.
